com.google.appinventor.components.runtime

Class Pedometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.AndroidNonvisibleComponent
      • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.Pedometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SensorEventListener, LocationListener, Component, Deleteable

    public class Pedometer
extends AndroidNonvisibleComponent
implements Component, LocationListener, SensorEventListener, Deleteable
    This component keeps count of steps using the accelerometer.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean CalibrateStrideLength()
      Tells Whether stride length calibration is currently going on.
      void CalibrateStrideLength(boolean cal)
      Starts the process of calibrating the stride length by comparing number of steps with the ditance covered (using the GPS).
      void CalibrationFailed()
      Indicates that the calibration has failed.
      float Distance()
      Returns the approximate distance traveled in meters.
      long ElapsedTime()
      Returns the time elapsed in milliseconds since the pedometer has started.
      void GPSAvailable()
      Indicates that the GPS is now available to use for distance measurement, and that calibration is now possible.
      void GPSLost()
      Indicates that the GPS signal is lost.
      boolean Moving()
      Returns the current status of motion.

      void Pause()
      Pauses the counting of steps.
      void Reset()
      Resets the step count, distance, and clock.
      void Resume()
      Resumes the counting of steps.
      void Save()
      Saves the pedometer state to shared preferences.

      Indicates that a step was taken.

      Starts the pedometer.
      void StartedMoving()
      Indicates that the device is moving.
      void Stop()
      Stops the pedometer.
      int StopDetectionTimeout()
      Returns the duration of idleness (no steps detected) after which to go into a "stopped" state.
      void StopDetectionTimeout(int timeout)
      Sets the duration of idleness (no steps detected) after which to go into a "stopped" state.
      void StoppedMoving()
      Indicates that the device has stopped.
      float StrideLength()
      Returns the current estimate of stride length in meters, if calibrated, or returns the default (0.73 m) otherwise.

      Specifies the stride length in meters.

      Returns whether the GPS is being used to measure distance.

      Specifies whether to use GPS, if signal is available, to compute distance.

      Indicates that a step was taken while walking.

    • Method Detail

      • Start

        public void Start()
        Starts the pedometer.

      • Stop

        public void Stop()
        Stops the pedometer.

      • Reset

        public void Reset()
        Resets the step count, distance, and clock.

      • Resume

        public void Resume()
        Resumes the counting of steps.

      • Pause

        public void Pause()
        Pauses the counting of steps.

      • Save

        public void Save()
        Saves the pedometer state to shared preferences.

      • SimpleStep

        public void SimpleStep(int simpleSteps,
              float distance)
        Indicates that a step was taken.
        Parameters:
        simpleSteps - number of raw steps detected
        distance - approximate distance covered by number of simpleSteps in meters

      • WalkStep

        public void WalkStep(int walkSteps,
            float distance)
        Indicates that a step was taken while walking. This will not be called if a single step is taken while standing still.
        Parameters:
        walkSteps - number of walking steps detected
        distance - approximate distance covered by the number of walkSteps in meters

      • StartedMoving

        public void StartedMoving()
        Indicates that the device is moving.

      • StoppedMoving

        public void StoppedMoving()
        Indicates that the device has stopped.

      • CalibrationFailed

        public void CalibrationFailed()
        Indicates that the calibration has failed. This could happen is the GPS is not active, or if the client has set UseGps to false.

      • GPSAvailable

        public void GPSAvailable()
        Indicates that the GPS is now available to use for distance measurement, and that calibration is now possible.

      • GPSLost

        public void GPSLost()
        Indicates that the GPS signal is lost.

      • CalibrateStrideLength

        public void CalibrateStrideLength(boolean cal)
        Starts the process of calibrating the stride length by comparing number of steps with the ditance covered (using the GPS).

      • CalibrateStrideLength

        public boolean CalibrateStrideLength()
        Tells Whether stride length calibration is currently going on.
        Returns:
        true if stride length calibration is currently going on, false otherwise.

      • StrideLength

        public void StrideLength(float length)
        Specifies the stride length in meters. The application can use this to explicitly set stride length to override the one calculated by the pedometer's calibration mechanism. As a side effect, this method turns off calibration of stride length using the GPS.
        Parameters:
        length - is the stride length in meters.

      • StrideLength

        public float StrideLength()
        Returns the current estimate of stride length in meters, if calibrated, or returns the default (0.73 m) otherwise.
        Returns:
        length of the stride in meters.

      • StopDetectionTimeout

        public void StopDetectionTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the duration of idleness (no steps detected) after which to go into a "stopped" state.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout in milliseconds.

      • StopDetectionTimeout

        public int StopDetectionTimeout()
        Returns the duration of idleness (no steps detected) after which to go into a "stopped" state.
        Returns:
        the timeout in milliseconds.

      • UseGPS

        public void UseGPS(boolean gps)
        Specifies whether to use GPS, if signal is available, to compute distance. This is set to true by default.
        Parameters:
        gps - true enables use of GPS, false disables GPS

      • UseGPS

        public boolean UseGPS()
        Returns whether the GPS is being used to measure distance.
        Returns:
        true if GPS is being used to measure distance, false otherwise.

      • Distance

        public float Distance()
        Returns the approximate distance traveled in meters.
        Returns:
        approximate distance traveled in meters.

      • Moving

        public boolean Moving()
        Returns the current status of motion.
        Returns:
        true if moving, false otherwise.

      • ElapsedTime

        public long ElapsedTime()
        Returns the time elapsed in milliseconds since the pedometer has started.
        Returns:
        time elapsed in milliseconds since the pedometer was started.
